elements.name: question2
elements.html:
When to File a UI Claim
You should submit an application for unemployment insurance (UI) during the week your employment status has changed. Some of those changes include:
  • You quit or were terminated from your job
  • Your hours were reduced
  • You are temporarily or permanently laid off

Note: You will not be able to report a future separation date on the application.

Minimum Eligibility Requirements:
  • You are totally or partially unemployed
  • You are unemployed through no fault of your own
  • You have worked and earned a certain amount of wages in Iowa in the last 18 months
    • If you have worked in another state and have not worked in Iowa in the last 18 months, you must contact the unemployment office in the state(s) where you have worked
  • You are able to work and available for work

Important Information You Might Need to File an Unemployment Insurance (UI) Claim
  • Your social security number (SSN)
  • Name, payroll address, work location and phone number of your last/current employer
  • Start and end dates of your employment
  • You may be asked to provide details about your employment status and ability to work
  • Name(s), SSN, date of birth, and relationship of any dependents that you claim on your income tax return
  • DD-214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (Member Copy 4) form information, if you served in the U.S. military during the last 18 months
    • Note: If you do not have your DD-214 at this time, you may be required to provide it in the future
  • Standard Form 8 Notice to Federal Employee about Unemployment Insurance (SF-8) or Standard Form 50 Notification of Personnel Action (SF-50), if you worked for the federal government in the last 18 months
  • Information about your pension, severance pay, and workers’ compensation (ex. effective date, amount, name of employer, etc.)
  • Your A/Alien/USCIS/I94 number and the immigration document name/type, if not a U.S. citizen
  • The name and local number of your labor union hiring hall

The Application Process
  • The information you enter on this application will be saved until 11:59 p.m. on Saturday MM/DD/YYYY, if you do not submit the application today
  • You will be logged out of the application if there is no activity for 30 minutes
  • It takes approximately 30 minutes to complete the application
  • You may be required to verify your identity during the application process

After you successfully submit the application, you will:
  • Be able to print a claim application summary for your records
  • Receive a claim confirmation number
  • Receive instructions for filing a weekly claim
  • Receive a link to the UI Handbook that outlines your rights and responsibilities
    • We recommend you review the UI Handbook before filing for UI benefits by clicking here: Unemployment Insurance Handbook
The UI Handbook explains your rights and responsibilities for claiming UI benefits. It answers common questions and covers general UI information.

WARNING:
You may be guilty of fraud if you make false statements, provide false information, or knowingly withhold information for the purpose of receiving benefits. If you commit UI fraud, you may be fined, penalized, and criminally prosecuted. You will be required to repay UI benefits you are not eligible to receive. If you have an overpayment as a result of fraud, you will not receive UI benefits until you have paid your debt in full.
Equal Opportunity is the Law

elements.name: Dependent Info Message
elements.html:
Qualified dependent(s) may increase your benefit amount. You may enter up to four (4) dependents.
A dependent may be:

Any person you claimed or will claim on your Federal tax return for tax year [YYYY] [This is the most recent calendar year ending prior to the BYB date, e.g., for a BYB of 12/30/2018, this YYYY would = 2017]
A spouse who earned $120 or less the we¬ek before you file the application

Exceptions are as follows:

A person who is listed as a dependent on another existing claim
A person who listed you as a dependent on their existing claim
You cannot list yourself as a dependent

Any dependent on this claim application will go through the identity verification process.

Only dependents with a verified identity will be added to the claim.

elements.name: question21
elements.html:
I acknowledge:
  • The statements and information I have provided on this application will be used to determine my eligibility for UI benefits and are subject to verification.
  • I may be guilty of fraud if I make false statements, provide false information, or knowingly withhold information to receive benefits.
  • If I commit UI fraud, I may be fined, penalized, and criminally prosecuted.
  • The information I provide to Iowa Workforce Development (IWD) may be made available to federal, state or local agencies and their subcontractors who administer employment and training programs.
  • I must repay any UI benefits paid to me that I am not eligible to receive.
  • I must file a weekly claim to request a benefit payment.
  • I must report any income earned while I am filing to collect UI benefits.
  • I must report any issues that might affect my ability to work or availability for work.
  • I must report any separation that happens while I am filing to collect UI benefits.
  • I must report if I refuse a job offer or referral.
  • I must report any issues that limit my availability to work or attend training.
  • I am required to know my rights and responsibilities while claiming UI benefits.
  • I am required to contact the UI customer service if I have questions about my responsibilities or requirements of receiving UI benefits.

I certify:
  • I will read the Unemployment Insurance Handbook.
  • I am totally or partially unemployed.
  • I am able to work or attend training.
  • I am registered for work by filing this application.
  • Statements I have made on this application and all attachments to it are true, accurate, and complete to the best of my knowledge and belief.

elements.name: Ack and Cert
elements.title: Do you agree to the following conditions above?

elements.name: BRI Info
elements.html:
Attention:
You must read the following Benefit Rights Information. You have a legal responsibility to know and follow all rules and requirements of the UI program. If you have a question about your responsibilities or the requirements of receiving benefits, the UI customer service is here to help. Please contact 1-866-239-0843.

Unemployment Insurance Handbook
The UI Handbook will answer most questions about your UI claim and help you avoid problems, delays, and improper payments. It explains your rights and responsibilities while claiming UI benefits. You are responsible for reading and knowing the contents of this handbook.

Access the Unemployment Insurance Handbook by clicking here:

Monetary Eligibility
We will send you a monetary record, if this is the first application you have filed in the past 12 months or more. Even though your Monetary Record may show UI benefit amounts, you must meet additional requirements to receive UI benefits.

Review the record carefully to make sure the information is accurate. Contact us immediately if any information is incorrect. Wages you earned in other states, from military or federal employer will not be listed on your first monetary record because these wages must be requested. Once we receive your wages, we will send you a corrected monetary record.

The Monetary Record shows the following:
  • Start date of the claim
  • Number of dependents claimed
  • Work search requirements
  • Weekly Benefit Amount (WBA)
  • Maximum Benefit Amount (MBA)
  • Employers you worked for during the base period and the last employer
  • Wages you earned each quarter
Requesting a UI Benefit Payment
To request a UI benefit payment, you must file a weekly claim. You may submit your first weekly claim on MM/DD/YYYY [First Sunday after the effective date of the claim]

You will be reporting information for the week of MM/DD/YYYY through MM/DD/YYYY. [Effective date of the claim through the Saturday after the effective date of the claim]

You can file your weekly claim online through your Claimant Portal.

You will be asked to report if you
  • Are totally or partially unemployed
  • Are able and available for work
  • Have refused any job offers or referrals
  • Are actively looking for work (unless waived)
  • Work search information (date applied for the job, position applied for, company contact information, etc.)
  • Have or will receive earnings, vacation pay, holiday pay, severance pay
  • Have or will receive pension and workers’ compensation
